results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia - Colony to Nation
results.brief_description:
Australian Aboriginals sail down a river to be followed by white people from England. People from other nations begin to make their journeys to Australia and the film ends with the Olympic flag and people from all nationalities gathered around it.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Cultural Development of Australia
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the enrichening of Australian food and cuture through the immigration and culural exchange of other races and creeds.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia: the encounter
results.brief_description:
Recounts the story of Matthew Flinder’s circumnavigation around Australia, his trials across the Tasman, involvement with the Nagarrindjeri tribe and his encounters with a French explorer. The Aboriginal people clash with these “white ghosts”. On his way home to England, Flinders is imprisoned in Mauritius and his prized cat, Trim is killed. A decade later, Flinders returns home to his family. Meanwhile, the violence upon Aboriginal sacred lands continues.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Matthew Flinders
results.brief_description:
A depiction of Matthew Flinders and his wife arriving at a shack and meeting Aboriginals. After what seems to be an attack by an Aboriginal on a white person, Flinders kills the Aboriginal and he and his wife set sail.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Cook's First Journey

This film depicts Captain Cook sailing and discovering new lands, meeting the natives and subsequently returning home.

results.title: A Matthew Flinders Story
results.brief_description:
A reenactment of the journey of Flinders, Bass and Martin to Botany Bay and Sydney Heads. They meet Aboriginals during their journey.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Mysteries of Ludwig Leicheart
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the historical journey across the Top End made by Ludwig Leicheart and his horse Rusty. They eat and sleep and upon waking, Leicheart gets attacked and killed by a dingo. Leicheart’s trusty horse avenges his master’s death by killing the dingo.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Land is me
results.brief_description: In addition to writing and singing the theme song, 10 year old Shannon scripted, animated and helped edit this short film about the impact of early Australian settlement on Aboriginal cultures. Overall Winner of the Screen It! competition 2004. An animated short entered to “Create a moving image work on the theme ‘Pacific Explorer” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Great Sea Explorer
results.brief_description:
The story of Matthew Flinders and his journey to Australia. After leaving his family in England, Flinders sets off to sea, and after many years travelling to and around Australia, he returns home. His heroic journey is rewarded by the Queen with a house as a gift for his exploration achievements.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.
